page.title: 08Lea School 1862-1873
page.content: Lea school was built in 1808 by {Florence Nightingale's}parents. We have taken these records from our school logs 1862-1889. In 1862, Lea school was hit by severe colds causing poor attendance, also,{Scarlet Fever}struck the school; this also occured eleven years later with{two deaths. } On Tuesday March 5th 1867 the children arrived early and locked the teachers out saying that it would last until half term. The average attendance in 1867 was about 120-130 while today in 1985 it is 85-95. {Smallpox}broke out in March 1865 resulting in the{death}of Edward Bunting. On Friday 24th March 1865 {Scarlett Fever}was discovered and again on 28th February 1873 with{two {deaths}on the same day. Also, two teachers had the fever.
